meanings.definition: The process of using sand or other abrasive materials to clean or smooth a surface.
meanings.sent1: Sandblasting can help make old metal surfaces look new again.
meanings.sent2: The building's exterior was refreshed with a round of sandblasting.
meanings.sent3: I heard they tried sandblasting the sidewalk to get rid of gum stains!
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like a sandblasting of my self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sandblasting echoed through the workshop, creating a cloud of dust.

meanings.definition: A method of removing paint or rust from a surface using high-pressure sand particles.
meanings.sent1: Sandblasting is a common technique in restoring old cars.
meanings.sent2: The shipyard used sandblasting to prepare the hull for repainting.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I'd see someone sandblasting a rusty old bike!
meanings.sent4: The harsh wind felt like a gentle sandblasting on my cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The sandblasting revealed the original color of the metal underneath all the rust.

meanings.definition: The act of propelling sand or abrasive materials at high velocity to shape or clean a surface.
meanings.sent1: Sandblasting is often used in creating intricate designs on glass.
meanings.sent2: The artist used sandblasting to etch patterns onto the mirror.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally ended up sandblasting my shoes while working on the driveway!
meanings.sent4: The storm felt like nature's own sandblasting of the coastline.
meanings.sent5: The intense sandblasting sculpted the rock into a beautiful formation.
